unnormalised: ## Choking on Progress: Let's Talk About Air Quality, Yaar!
normalised: ## Choking on Progress: Let us Talk About Air Quality, Yaar!

unnormalised: Hey everyone! So, we all know Delhi air during Diwali time is practically legendary (for the wrong reasons!). But honestly, air quality is something we should be thinking about all year round, not just around 25/10. It's a bigger deal than that auntyji who always comments on your weight!
normalised: Hey everyone! So, we all know Delhi air during Diwali time is practically legendary (for the wrong reasons!). But honestly, air quality is something we should be thinking about all year round, not just around twenty fifth october. It is a bigger deal than that auntyji who always comments on your weight!

unnormalised: We’re talking about the very air we breathe, right? From the bustling streets of Mumbai to the serene backwaters of Kerala, every corner of India is affected, though to varying degrees. Remember that trip to Agra last year? The Taj Mahal looked a bit…grey. Not exactly postcard-perfect, right? That's pollution, folks!
normalised: We are talking about the very air we breathe, right? From the bustling streets of Mumbai to the serene backwaters of Kerala, every corner of India is affected, though to varying degrees. Remember that trip to Agra last year? The Taj Mahal looked a bit…grey. Not exactly postcard-perfect, right? That is pollution, folks!

unnormalised: The problem? A whole mishmash of things. Vehicle emissions, especially those old autos chugging around, industrial pollution from places like Kanpur, construction dust – it all adds up. And let's not forget the burning of crop residue, a major culprit particularly in Punjab and Haryana after the harvest season around 14/04.

And let us not forget the burning of crop residue, a major culprit particularly in Punjab and Haryana after the harvest season around fourteenth april.

unnormalised: Now, you might be thinking, "Okay, so the air isn't great. What can I, a single chidiya, do about it?" Well, plenty! For starters, understanding the Air Quality Index (AQI) is crucial. You can check the AQI for your area online or through apps – knowledge is power, bhai!

unnormalised: The government's also trying, with initiatives like the National Clean Air Programme (NCAP). Institutions like IIT Delhi are researching innovative solutions, but these take time. We need to do our bit too.
normalised: The government is also trying, with initiatives like the National Clean Air Programme (N C A P). Institutions like I I T Delhi are researching innovative solutions, but these take time. We need to do our bit too.

unnormalised: Things like using public transport (Delhi Metro zindabad!), carpooling, planting trees (even a small tulsi plant helps!), and being mindful of our consumption habits. And most importantly, spreading awareness. Talk to your friends, family, and that Sharma uncle who drives his polluting old Ambassador at 7:00 AM every morning.

unnormalised: Air pollution isn't some far-off problem; it's impacting our health right now. Headaches, respiratory issues, even long-term illnesses. Let's make sure our future generations can breathe easy. Let's strive for cleaner air, for a healthier India! Jai Hind!
